info.title: Open Data API
info.description: Latest Swagger specification for OpenData Personal Current Account data

tags.name: PCA
tags.description: Endpoint for getting Personal Current Account data

get.description: Gets a list of all `Personal Current Account` objects.

parameters.name: If-Modified-Since
parameters.description: Used for conditional request, to retrieve data only if modified since a given date

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description: Used for conditional request, to retrieve data only if the given Etag value does not match

200.description: Successful response with a list of `Personal Current Account` data

Etag.description: A unique ID identifying whether this resource has changed

Cache-Control.description: Describes how long this response can be cached

X-Frame-Options.description: Prevent this request from being loaded in any iframes

X-Content-Type-Options.description: Ensures each page has a content type and prevents browsers from doing MIME type sniffing

enum: Use of the APIs and any related data will be subject to the terms of the Open Licence and subject to terms and conditions

Brand.description: Brand registered by the banking group at https://register.fca.org.uk/
Brand.title: Brand

items.description: Brand registered by the banking group at https://register.fca.org.uk/

BrandName.description: Brand Name that an organisation uses to market its products or services to a consumer as registered at https://register.fca.org.uk/
BrandName.title: BrandName

PCA.title: PCA

Name.description: The name of the PCA product used for marketing purposes from a customer perspective. I.e. what the customer would recognise.
Name.title: Name

Identification.description: The unique ID that has been internally assigned by the financial institution to each of the current account banking products they market to their retail and/or small to medium enterprise (SME) customers.
Identification.title: Identification

Segment.description:
Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another.

Read more: Market Segmentation http://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/marketsegmentation.asp#ixzz4gfEEalTd
Follow us: Investopedia on Facebook

With respect to PCA products, they are segmented in relation to different markets that they wish to focus on. For example, Basic PCA products target consumers with poor credit history, Reward PCA products target consumers who spend a lot, and Premium products target High Net Worth individuals.
Segment.title: Segment

items.description:
Market segmentation is a marketing term referring to the aggregating of prospective buyers into groups, or segments, that have common needs and respond similarly to a marketing action. Market segmentation enables companies to target different categories of consumers who perceive the full value of certain products and services differently from one another.

Read more: Market Segmentation http://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/marketsegmentation.asp#ixzz4gfEEalTd
Follow us: Investopedia on Facebook

With respect to PCA products, they are segmented in relation to different markets that they wish to focus on. For example, Basic PCA products target consumers with poor credit history, Reward PCA products target consumers who spend a lot, and Premium products target High Net Worth individuals.

OnSaleIndicator.description: Indicates that the published product is OnSale(value 1) or Back Book (value 0)
OnSaleIndicator.title: OnSaleIndicator

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the product details
Notes.title: Notes

PCAMarketingState.description: Describes the type of the known state (regular, promotional )  of the product.
PCAMarketingState.title: PCAMarketingState

items.description: Describes the type of the known state (regular, promotional )  of the product.

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a  Eligibility Marketing state.
Identification.title: Identification

PredecessorID.description: Identifies the marketing state that precedes this marketing state
PredecessorID.title: PredecessorID

MarketingState.description: Describes the marketing state (regular or promotional) for which the eligibility criteria applies
MarketingState.title: MarketingState

StateTenureLength.description: The length/duration of a promotional state
StateTenureLength.title: StateTenureLength

StateTenurePeriod.description: The unit of period (days, weeks, months etc.) of the promotional length
StateTenurePeriod.title: StateTenurePeriod

Notes.description: Free text for adding details for marketing state
Notes.title: Notes

CreditInterest.description: Details about the interest that may be payable to the PCA account holders
CreditInterest.title: CreditInterest

TierBandSet.description: The group of tiers or bands for which credit interest can be applied.
TierBandSet.title: TierBandSet

items.description: The group of tiers or bands for which credit interest can be applied.

TierBandMethod.description:
The methodology of how credit interest is paid/applied. It can be:-

1. Banded
Interest rates are banded. i.e. Increasing rate on whole balance as balance increases.

2. Tiered
Interest rates are tiered. i.e. increasing rate for each tier as balance increases, but interest paid on tier fixed for that tier and not on whole balance.

3. Whole
The same interest rate is applied irrespective of the PCA balance
TierBandMethod.title: TierBandMethod

Destination.description: Describes whether accrued interest is payable only to the PCA or to another bank account
Destination.title: Destination

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the Tier Band Set details
Notes.title: Notes

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a  Tier Band for a PCA.
Identification.title: Identification

TierValueMinimum.description: Minimum deposit value for which the credit interest tier applies.
TierValueMinimum.title: TierValueMinimum

TierValueMaximum.description: Maximum deposit value for which the credit interest tier applies.
TierValueMaximum.title: TierValueMaximum

CalculationFrequency.description: How often is credit interest calculated for the account.
CalculationFrequency.title: CalculationFrequency

ApplicationFrequency.description: How often is interest applied to the PCA for this tier/band i.e. how often the financial institution pays accumulated interest to the customer's PCA.
ApplicationFrequency.title: ApplicationFrequency

FixedVariableInterestRateType.description: Type of interest rate, Fixed or Variable
FixedVariableInterestRateType.title: FixedVariableInterestRateType

AER.description:
The annual equivalent rate (AER) is interest that is calculated under the assumption that any interest paid is combined with the original balance and the next interest payment will be based on the slightly higher account balance. Overall, this means that interest can be compounded several times in a year depending on the number of times that interest payments are made.

Read more: Annual Equivalent Rate (AER) http://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/aer.asp#ixzz4gfR7IO1A
AER.title: AER

BankInterestRateType.description: Interest rate types, other than AER, which financial institutions may use to describe the annual interest rate payable to the PCA.
BankInterestRateType.title: BankInterestRateType

BankInterestRate.description: Bank Interest for the PCA product
BankInterestRate.title: BankInterestRate

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the Tier Band details
Notes.title: Notes

OtherBankInterestType.description: Other interest rate types which are not available in the standard code list
OtherBankInterestType.title: OtherBankInterestType

Notes.description: Associated Notes about the overdraft rates
Notes.title: Notes

TcsAndCsURL.description: URL provided by the financial institution which redirects to the PCA Overdraft T&Cs on an external website
TcsAndCsURL.title: TcsAndCsURL

TierBandMethod.description:
The methodology of how overdraft is charged. It can be:
'Whole'  Where the same charge/rate is applied to the entirety of the overdraft balance (where charges are applicable).
'Tiered' Where different charges/rates are applied dependent on overdraft maximum and minimum balance amount tiers defined by the lending financial organisation
'Banded' Where different charges/rates are applied dependent on overdraft maximum and minimum balance amount bands defined by a government organisation.
TierBandMethod.title: TierBandMethod

OverdraftType.description: An overdraft can either be 'committed' which means that the facility cannot be withdrawn without reasonable notification before it's agreed end date, or 'on demand' which means that the financial institution can demand repayment at any point in time.
OverdraftType.title: OverdraftType

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a  Tier Band for a overdraft product.
Identification.title: Identification

AuthorisedIndicator.description: Indicates if the Overdraft is authorised (Y) or unauthorised (N)
AuthorisedIndicator.title: AuthorisedIndicator

BufferAmount.description: When a customer exceeds their credit limit, a financial institution will not charge the customer unauthorised overdraft charges if they do not exceed by more than the buffer amount. Note: Authorised overdraft charges may still apply.
BufferAmount.title: BufferAmount

MinimumArrangedOverdraftAmount.description: An overdraft is an extension of credit from a lending institution when an account reaches zero. An overdraft allows the individual to continue withdrawing money even if the account has no funds in it or not enough to cover the withdrawal. Some banking products require an accountholder to take an Arranged Overdraft(minimum) of at least X amount, or else a bank will not process an Arranged Overdraft request.
MinimumArrangedOverdraftAmount.title: MinimumArrangedOverdraftAmount

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the overdraft Tier Band Set details
Notes.title: Notes

OverdraftTierBand.description: Provides overdraft details for a specific tier or band
OverdraftTierBand.title: OverdraftTierBand

items.description: Provides overdraft details for a specific tier or band

Identification.description: Unique and unambiguous identification of a  Tier Band for a overdraft.
Identification.title: Identification

OverdraftInterestChargingCoverage.description: Interest charged on whole amount or tiered/banded
OverdraftInterestChargingCoverage.title: OverdraftInterestChargingCoverage

BankGuaranteedIndicator.description: Indicates that a bank provides the overdraft limit up to TierValueMIn to all customers automatically
BankGuaranteedIndicator.title: BankGuaranteedIndicator

EAR.description:
EAR means Effective Annual Rate and/or Equivalent Annual Rate (frequently
used interchangeably), being the actual annual interest rate of an Overdraft.
EAR.title: EAR

RepresentativeAPR.description: An annual percentage rate (APR) is the annual rate charged for borrowing or earned through an investment. APR is expressed as a percentage that represents the actual yearly cost of funds over the term of a loan. This includes any fees or additional costs associated with the transaction but does not take compounding into account.
RepresentativeAPR.title: RepresentativeAPR

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the Tier/band details
Notes.title: Notes

Amount.title: Amount

Indicator.description: Any eligibility criteria where the value can be indicated by a true or false value. UKResident is True or False
Indicator.title: Indicator

Textual.description: Any eligibility criteria where a long description is supplied
Textual.title: Textual

Period.description: Period for which the other eligibility criteria applies.
Period.title: Period

Notes.description: Optional additional notes to supplement the eligibility conditions.
Notes.title: Notes

enum: You have requested this resource too often. Slow down.
